com.scorch.core.modules.punish

Class Punishment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scorch.core.modules.punish.Punishment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Punishment>

    public class Punishment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Punishment>
    Punishment is an entry to a player's Punishment History, supports OfflinePlayer banning, run the execute function to run commands/punishments (should only be run once)
    Author:
    imodm

    • Constructor Detail

      • Punishment

        public Punishment(java.util.UUID target,
                  java.lang.String staff,
                  java.lang.String reason,
                  long date,
                  long duration,
                  PunishType type)
        Creates a new punishment
        Parameters:
        target - UUID of the player to be punished
        staff - Staff Username of the CommandSender that applied the punishment
        reason - Reason for the punishment
        date - Date of creation
        duration - How long the punishment is (-1 for permanent)
        type - PunishType type of punishment

      • Punishment

        public Punishment()
        Empty contructor for the datamanager

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Runs the punishment and any appropriate actions. (Sending messages to staff members, kicking players, etc.) Ideally should only be run once.

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String remover,
                   java.lang.String removeReason)
        Renders the punishment ineffective does not delete the punishment uses the System.currentTimeMillis() as removal date
        Parameters:
        remover - Staff Username of the CommandSender that applied the punishment.
        removeReason - Reason that the punishment was removed.

      • getKickMessage

        public java.lang.String getKickMessage()
        Gets the kick message that is formatted for when the player tries to login while punished with a PunishType.restrictsLogin() true punishment Will return null if no kick message is appropriate.
        Returns:
        Single line message with \n and '&' that should be appropriately formatted (\n) is automatically by the MC client

      • getVerb

        public java.lang.String getVerb()
